patient_info: Tall stature,Mitral valve prolapse,Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy,Abnormal aortic valve morphology,Mitral regurgitation,Aortic regurgitation,Tricuspid valve prolapse,Left ventricular hypertrophy,Dyspnea,Aortic root aneurysm,Kyphoscoliosis,Tachypnea,Back pain,Exercise intolerance,Tricuspid regurgitation,Heart murmur,Chest pain
golden_diagnosis: Neonatal Marfan syndrome,Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Mitral Valve Prolapse (MVP): This is a common structural heart defect where the mitral valve bulges into the left atrium.
2. Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM): This is a type of restrictive heart muscle disease characterized by thickening of the heart muscle and impaired systolic heart function.
3. Marfan syndrome: This is a genetic disorder that affects the connective tissue, causing cardiovascular and joint abnormalities.
4. Aortic valve disease: This includes aortic stenosis, aortic regurgitation, and aortic valve prolapse.
5. Heart failure: This is a condition where the heart is unable to pump blood efficiently to the body tissues.
6. Aortic root aneurysm: This is a progressive dilation of the aortic root, leading to a risk of aortic dissection.
7. Mitral regurgitation: This occurs when the mitral valve leaks and there is regurgitation of blood back into the atria.
8. Kyphoscoliosis: This is an abnormal curvature of the spine in the thoracic region.
9. Cardiomyopathy: This is a disorder of the heart muscle, leading to impaired cardiac function.
10. Pulmonary hypertension: This is high blood pressure in the lungs, caused by a variety of conditions and leading to symptoms of dyspnea, exercising intolerance, and tachypnea.
